steps.notes: Successfully navigated to Settings menu. Sidebar expanded showing all settings options including Payroll.
Clicked Payroll link, navigated to Payroll settings page.
Daily Wage Calculation section found and verified. Expanded view shows table with 3 calculation services: Salary proration, EOS leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction.
Opened Salary Proration configuration modal showing Month calculation dropdown.
Calculation type dropdown expanded showing all three options: Working days, Calendar days, Custom days. Currently set to Custom days with 30.45 days.
Salary components selection not fully explored in this session.
End of Service eligibility section expanded showing leave types table.
Configure button verified. Table shows 2 leave types: Vacation45 (Basic salary + allowances / Custom days) and Test Leen 11 (Basic salary + allowances / Calendar days).

key_findings: Daily Wage Calculator located at: Settings > Payroll > Daily Wage Calculation
Three calculation services identified: Salary proration (30.45 days), EOS leave encashment (60 days), Unpaid leave deduction (30 days)
Calculation type options available: Working days, Calendar days, Custom days with configurable day count
End of Service eligibility section contains leave type configurations with daily rate calculation methods
Leave encashment policy section present with table showing existing policies
All UI elements are accessible and functional in the test environment
Configuration modals provide clear formula displays showing how daily wage is calculated
recommendations: Complete remaining journeys (4-10) to validate full feature configuration workflow
Test salary components selection to verify which components can be included in calculations
Validate Leave Policies configuration for unpaid leave deduction calculations
Access actual employee payroll data to test backend calculation accuracy
Verify leave encashment policy creation workflow by clicking 'Add new' button
Test End of Service eligibility Configure button to see detailed configuration options
